comment:
Follow the instruction for the lab note and do the experiments in time.
Then you will get A.
He is not a tough grader. As long as you do your work, he will give you 100.
Finals, discussions were EASY
Got 100 for all lap notebook.
Loved him so much!! just make sure to have your lab notebook filled out:)

Professor Deka is very quiet so if you have difficult hearing, sit near the front of the lab when he talks or goes over the lab. Professor Deka is very kind and helps students out when they have questions during the lab. However, he's strict about the lab notebook that he mandates every student to have while in his class.

Sit middle row so your able to hear him, look at labflow feedback on notebook uploads so you don't make same mistakes on future uploads. everything is very straight forward and he was always available when I needed help or had questions. If you don't pass this class it truly is on you not sure how anyone can not easily pass. Would take him again!

He is very quiet so try and sit towards the front of the class but he is a cool dude and he makes the content easy to understand and he is very lenient with grading so if you miss something just email him and he should help you out.

Everything was straight forward. If you follow his directions, you would make an A! We did the same thing every week which did have a lot of writing because of the lab, but everything isn't bad because I tended to do things the day before. Pre-Lab quiz, post-lab, and submitting pictures of labs MAKE SURE IT'S IN PDF
THE WORST. Made life hard on purpose. He literally would get mad when I asked a question. Made me cry my first day. Please don't take him.

Dr. Deka is a really good professor! This class can be simple and easy if you do your notebook/lab reports on time and ask questions. He genuinely cares about your understanding of chemistry. Ask questions! Closed mouths don't get fed! He's a very helpful professor. I will also say that he is soft spoken, so if you can, sit close to the front.

Take him, I really enjoyed his labs. He is very approachable and quick to answering any questions you have. Make sure you keep your notebook neat and organized, and as long as you show up to the labs and do your work the class will not be difficult. Take him he is great and cares about his students and just wants them to learn and succeed!

Take him, take him! He is such a caring professor. His class is not hard, you just need to do your work! I absolutely loved taking his chemistry lab, I learned more in it than I did in my chemistry lecture. He is very approachable and does not mind if you ask questions. He honestly wants you to learn and understand in his lab. Loved him! 10/10!

Dr. Deka can come across harsh but if you show up and do the lab, he will help you through it and is nice about it. You need to keep your lab notebook nice and organized but he gives you the guidelines for it and it's honestly simple. He doesn't want to give you a bad grade and will tell the class that it feels bad to. Ask questions, and show up.

Professor Deka dees not help at all when a question is asked, he gets upset and gives attitude. When you ask a question that he answers his response is just that you are wrong but does not explain why.

Took this class during the fall semester of 2022. It was hybrid class so one week was online and the other was in person. Professor Ganesh had a heavy accent at times so you had to pay attention to what he was saying. Sometimes he would tell you what to write for an answer in the lab, but would grade it as wrong.

Very strict on grading. Misspelled words counted off(not LA class) and just very minor mistakes or differences in answers. Do not abbreviate words as those will also be counted against. Really nice guy but is hard to understand and feels like he doesn't know the material himself. Directions seemed unclear and not even present at times.

Don't take this professor. He is a very hard grader. MUST ATTEND CLASS OR GET A ZERO. You have to have everything in your notebook for that day before you come to class; otherwise, you won't be let into class and will receive a zero. He talks very low and doesn't care that you can't hear. Also catches an attitude when you ask a question.
A good teacher if you just do your work and notebook is prepared before coming into in person lab. Very nice but does talk quiet.

Guys please don't take him for lab. This man is a horrible grader and will take off points just because he feels like it. A lot of times I was told how to get the right answer and when its time for the work to be graded I get the same question wrong. Don't take him guys!

Please take another professor for this course if you can. He grades incredibly hard and when my lab parter and I would ask questions we would be told that our numbers were correct only to get the same answers wrong in the lab flow. Grades very harshly and unfairly. You will be more confused than you were originally when asking him any questions.

Dr.Deka is a nice and caring person. He cares about your grade and how you do in the class, but when it comes to grading he is very tough. There were a lot of time when I had to ask him why I got my data entries incorrect.

He is a very sweet man. The class is very heavy especially over the summer. There is something due almost everyday. There is a test every week which often included 1211 and 1212 concepts versus 1151. He tries his best to help where you are confused but it often makes it worse. He cares a ton about his job but for your GPA, steer clear.

I thought this would be an easy class considering it's a one-credit-hour course. I'm taking 4 classes in total this summer (this one being the only 1 credit hour). None of my classes have as much work as his. He is very picky on his grading and doesn't give feedback as to what you did wrong. Don't take him.

As long as you participate in the labs and do your content assessments you are sure to pass the class. He drops your lowest content assessment, quiz,and lab. even though his accent is kinda heavy you can understand him well if you pay attention
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Deka was amazing! I was scared going in because of bad ratings, but he was my favorite! As long as you show up, read the lab, and actually do it, youll be fine! Its not as bad as they make it seem.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things

comment: Since he is ethnic, it's hard to hear/understand him when he's talking, hard to get in touch with, but a good person. I kept forgetting to submit stuff into LabFlow which messed up my grade a bit and tried to email him but I got nothing. Just make sure you don't forget to submit. other than that, easy A.

TBH just show up to the labs so you don't fall behind. They are not due until the end of the next week but it's way easier to do it when he is on a class call because he can explain to you where you might have went wrong. Another thing is his accent did make it a little hard to understand him but eventually you get what he is trying to say.

He's really sweet, but he's not very good at explaining things. He also has a hard time understanding questions. I don't know if it's because English isn't his first language, but that might be it. If you're good at self-guided study this class should be fine for you, but if you need more guidance you should try for a different professor.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Caring

comment: Do not take this man's class at all. I took Organic Chemistry before his class thinking OChem was the hardest course ever to take. I was wrong. This man makes the course 10x more difficult for a core class that freshmen typically register for. Grading is very strict on papers and in Labflow and he makes careless errors multiple times.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: First class he said he was just there to supervise us while we did our lab at home. He didnt answer any good questions except about  sig figs. Dose not really help you when it comes to labs. He just babysits i guess.

If I could give a 0 I would. DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS UNLESS YOUR DOWN AND BAD AND HAVE TO. If your a nursing major especially, worst idea ever. I had a 4.0 before his class and he does not help with anything. If you ask him something he will answer with the broadest answer ever. Do Not hurt yourself to take this class. Wait for a better professor!

Not horrible but he is picky; had an A all semester but dropped my grade to a B due to a personal evaluation so make sure you attend all labs and have neat work he is very picky & will take points off for sloppy work & if images are not uploaded as a PDF he doesnt really answer questions about lab so make sure you have a good GroupMe for help!!

I don't know why he is rated so bad he really isn't bad at all. Before the semester even began I had trouble getting my lab supplies from the company and he helped me out. He responds to emails very fast and explains the labs pretty well. I've had better but definitely had way worse. (Covid-19 Fall semester)

Professor Deka is the best! He is very kind and goes above and beyond for his students. He communicates well and explains the labs in detail before you start them. He also makes himself available during the lab for any questions you have. I would 100% take him again. He is such a sweet man and a very good professor!

Absolutely terrible. He doesnt know how to explain ANYTHING. He doesnt care about you OR your grade. Every time I asked him for help he basically told me to figure it out. Do NOT take him. Especially the nursing majors. 0/10.

He really doesnt know how to explain things. Hes definitely not one of those professors to remind you about different assignments. Every time I asked him for help he basically told me to figure it out on my own. Just save yourself the trouble.

Mr. Deka will remove points on lab reports for sig figs or answers without units--which makes sense. Science and healthcare are about precision. However, he is a kindhearted man. Mr. Deka expects students to put in the preparation and work to do well in the class, but he is always available to talk or to help. I loved him and would take him again.
Deka is a very harsh grader. You need to do everything to the point to get a 100.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: The ABSOLUTE worst teacher I have ever taken. I asked questions constantly to receive feedback, he told me I should already know the material. If he does not like you, your grades go down tremendously. He responds to emails however is no help. DO NOT take his class if you have another choice. His accent is super thick and really hard to understand.

Deka expects you to understand EVERY single thing there has to do with lab before even signing up for his class. He is rude and very difficult to get a hold of. His English is not so great, so if that annoys you then beware. He gets frustrated if you need to ask a question or if you need help. I do NOT recommend this professor to anyone! STAY AWAY!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: HORRIBLE. He is a tough grader. He takes points off for every little thing that you do. When you ask for help he tells you it is very simple and does not provide an explanation what so ever. if you have the chance to take a different teacher, take another teacher.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: when he grades he gives AWFUL feedback, he takes off for every little thing you do wrong. Really hard to ask for help as he assumes you know everything already. Do NOT take him if there is another option. He is really nice, however really hard to hear him and his grading scale sucks.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: If you make a mistake on your lab report, he tells you exactly what it is and you note to fix it next time. Quizzes and content assessments are online and basically a review from chem lecture. If you do your work and be precise on your lab reports, you'll make an A. Lab instructions are detailed and he's willing to help.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Tough grader

comment: Grades based on grammar and spelling for lab reports. Which... idk why. Heavy accent and doesnt explain things very well. Super soft spoken so I struggle to hear him. Strikes me as somewhat misogynistic.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: I liked this class because he was funny and was ready to help answer any questions you had during the lab. He specifically told our lab class he would be rounding up grades if we were close to getting an A. I got an 89.99 and was denied being rounded up because of unfairness to other students. Despite this being upsetting, its not a hard class.

Professor Deka is precious. He can be hard to understand because his accent is very heavy, but he is extremely caring and wants everyone to do well. The online portion of the class is pretty easy, and the labs aren't awful. He will literally walk you through everything, and answer any questions you have about setting up the lab. I love him
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects

comment: He is the best! He makes sure you are comfortable with the work you are doing, and if you aren't he is always there to help. He is very knowledgeable and caring. He wants everyone to succeed.
